annual compensation rising 5 - 6 percent a year

text: The Wall Street Journal " Outlook " observes , " In the U.S. job market , the balance of power is shifting to employees from employers , " and states that " the retention frenzy was triggered in part by previous waves of corporate downsizing , " which left behind survivors who took stock of career options and used Internet job listings and intensified recruiting to land better offers , which in turn led to counter - offers and higher salaries . This has led , says the Journal , to annual compensation rising 5 - 6 percent a year .
